intro: Rubus lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blackberry, is a species of bramble native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and thorny stems. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are typically harvested in the fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Rubus lanceolatus is often found in woodlands, thickets, and along stream banks.
